item.title: Problem Set 1
item.description: Life expectancy in 2007 library(tidyverse) # This loads ggplot2, dplyr, and other packages you'll need library(gapminder) # This loads the gapminder data Let’s first look at the first few rows of data: head(gapminder) ## # A tibble: 6 x 6 ## country continent year lifeExp pop gdpPercap ## <fct> <fct> <int> <dbl> <int> <dbl> ## 1 Afghanistan Asia 1952 28.8 8425333 779. ## 2 Afghanistan Asia 1957 30.3 9240934 821.

item.title: Problem Set 2
item.description: Instructions In addition to running the code, you will need to do two things: either write in complete sentences a response or write R code to fill in a chunk. “xxxxx” = Write, in complete English sentences, your response. 1-2 sentences is sufficient. “Plot” = Write R code in the chunk corresponding to the instructions. Analyzing CMPD Traffic Stops For this problem set, we’ll examine a data set of stops by the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department (CMPD).

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
